bbb2f7ca-4ad8-420a-b3b6-13c2fd264084.description: Earners of this credential have demonstrated research-based best practices and understand the expectations of being an online instructor at SLCC. Earners are able to orient students to an online environment, maintain an active presence in their courses, create a safe, respectful learning community, provide clear expectations and effective feedback to students, facilitate online discussions, monitor student progress, and manage the online teaching workload.
bbb2f7ca-4ad8-420a-b3b6-13c2fd264084.name: SLCC Online Teacher Credential

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete this online course, which is facilitated by online teaching veterans at SLCC. Satisfactorily complete all assignments in the course, including the final project.

fdbc68ef-f239-4ddc-ac7f-0f34395f7343.description: Earners of this credential have demonstrated the ability to use the key features of the Instructure Canvas Learning Management System. Earners are able to use navigation elements and components, add a syllabus to a course, create and grade assignments, create quizzes, use communication tools, and use the Canvas' multimedia tools.
fdbc68ef-f239-4ddc-ac7f-0f34395f7343.name: SLCC Canvas User Credential

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete this online course, which is facilitated by Canvas experts at SLCC. Satisfactorily complete all assignments in the course, including the final project.

41c133d2-0dec-46e8-88ae-fa5d8630c9d2.description: Earners of this credential have demonstrated how to develop a fully online course that meets Quality Matters standards. Earners are able to use the backward design process to ensure alignment of course objectives, assessments, and materials, identify instructional strategies for online delivery, implement principles of student-centered online learning, write for online learning, develop valid and reliable assessments, follow principles of multimedia use, and create accessible course materials.
41c133d2-0dec-46e8-88ae-fa5d8630c9d2.name: SLCC Online Course Designer Credential

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Work with eLearning to develop an online course that meets Quality Matters standards. Follow a team approach to course creation that includes multiple faculty, designers, technologists, media developers, and graphic artists. Follow the timeline of a course development project over the course of a year.

c9cd00ac-6448-45de-baa8-0601b37b3cef.description: SLCC Search Advocates are trained, external search committee members who promote efforts to improve equity, diversity, and inclusivity within valid, evidentiary-based searches and hiring processes. Their preparation involves a two-day training and continuing education to learn effective strategies to be an advocate on searches.
c9cd00ac-6448-45de-baa8-0601b37b3cef.name: SLCC Search Advocate Credential

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: To obtain a SLCC Search Advocate certification you must participate in either the online canvas training or our 2-day in-person training. To maintain your certificate of completion, please attend at least TWO Community of Practice (CoP) sessions per year. Community of Practice sessions are for search advocates who have completed the in-person or online training. Our CoP sessions are for the professional development of our search advocates.

95d2839e-1ab8-416f-b475-7acc6c325511.description: This online, facilitated course focuses on teaching practices that support learning and educational equity for community college students from diverse social, cultural, racial, linguistic, and educational backgrounds. Participants complete course development activities and work toward redesigning a course based on principles for effective, equitable, and inclusive teaching.
95d2839e-1ab8-416f-b475-7acc6c325511.name: Equitable & Inclusive Teaching Practices Course Credential

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Participants complete a short orientation and eight, 2-hour modules (one per week) with readings, videos, reflection questions, learning activities, and online discussions. At the end of the course, each participant submits a reflection and inclusive teaching action plan.

722e2e67-305c-449d-b5cf-48f184bb7634.description: Earners of the Broadcast Teacher Credential (BTC) have demonstrated skill in teaching broadcast (live-streamed) courses. To earn the credential, participants must satisfactorily complete the Broadcast Teacher Credential course. For the capstone course assignment, participants use synchronous technology tools to deliver an interactive lesson that demonstrates teaching strategies that promote active learning in a remote learning environment.
722e2e67-305c-449d-b5cf-48f184bb7634.name: Broadcast Teacher Credential

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete this online course, which is facilitated by broadcast teaching experts at Salt Lake Community College. Satisfactorily complete all assignments in the course, including the final project.

skills.name: Demonstrate teaching strategies that promote active learning in a remote learning environment
Discuss privacy and equity concerns related to teaching in a remote learning environment
Facilitate active learning in a remote learning environment
Model best practices for web conferencing
Orient students to a remote learning environment
Set expectations for students in a remote learning environment
Teach an interactive lesson in a remote learning environment using synchronous technology tools

bc8e79b5-b857-4c1e-9065-1e6f7d768658.description: Earners of this credential have demonstrated how to effectively conduct Quality Matters course reviews. Earners are able to identify the underlying principles of QM, apply the QM rubric to review online courses, apply the concept of alignment, and draft civil and professional recommendations for course improvement by citing annotations from the QM rubric and evidence from the course.
bc8e79b5-b857-4c1e-9065-1e6f7d768658.name: SLCC Online Course Reviewer Credential

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Quality Matters’ Applying the Quality Matters Rubric (APPQMR) course
Complete Quality Matters’ Peer Reviewer Course (PRC) course
Satisfactorily complete one formal course review using the Quality Matters rubric and the Quality Matters Course Review Management System

8e20cc32-5778-4b10-be89-2deb6bf094c9.description: This credential represents the successful completion of a self-paced Writing Across the College Canvas course that explores how English Language Learning students experience higher education and provides best practices for writing instruction. Upon completion, participants will understand how diverse ELL students--and their language use—are, recognize the challenges of writing in a target language, and how to provide equitable writing instruction and assessment to all students.
8e20cc32-5778-4b10-be89-2deb6bf094c9.name: Working Well With ELL Writers

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this credential, a participant must successfully complete the self-paced Canvas course, “Working Well with ELL Writers.” This course requires the completion of ten modules, each including video presentations and reflective responses. After finishing the modules, participants must engage in a half-hour informal one-on-one conversation with the Writing Across the College director or learning community discussion. At the end of the course, the participant will identify at least three strat

d4e93865-8084-41e9-a906-c378111688a5.description: This credential represents the successful completion of a self-paced Writing Across the College Canvas course that asks participants to reflect on how students experience writing instruction, assignments, and assessment in their courses. Upon completion, participants will have a better understanding of how students experience writing in higher education and a set of practices/strategies that improve both student and faculty relationships with writing.
d4e93865-8084-41e9-a906-c378111688a5.name: Developing Successful Student Writers

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this credential, a participant must successfully complete the self-paced Canvas course, “Developing Successful Student Writers.” This course requires the completion of eleven modules, each including video presentations and reflective responses. After finishing the modules, participants must engage in a half-hour informal one-on-one conversation with the Writing Across the College director or learning community discussion. At the end of the course, the participant will identify at least

3ffba675-9781-4bd2-942b-633b7cd84188.description: Earners of this credential have demonstrated how to develop a competency-based course that meets Quality Matters standards. Earners are able to use the backward design process to ensure alignment of course objectives, assessments, and materials, identify instructional strategies for competency-based delivery, implement principles of student-centered learning, develop valid and reliable assessments, follow principles of multimedia use, and create accessible course materials.
3ffba675-9781-4bd2-942b-633b7cd84188.name: SLCC CBE Course Design Credential

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Work with eLearning to develop a competency-based course that meets Quality Matters standards. Follow a team approach to course creation that includes multiple faculty, designers, technologists, media developers, and graphic artists. Follow the timeline of a course development project over the course of a year.

11cdad62-bac3-46a0-830c-225438abf7be.description: This facilitated online learning community builds on activities from EITP Level 1. Participants learn about and apply principles for culturally responsive teaching as they work on assessing and improving a course (or set of courses). Instructors work together to think through complex issues related to supporting community college learners from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds.
11cdad62-bac3-46a0-830c-225438abf7be.name: EITP Level 2: Culturally Responsive Teaching

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Participants spent 16 hours in learning community activities that included reading a discussion book, engaging in online discussions, completing course development activities, reflecting on teaching, and documenting teaching practices through a professional ePortfolio page.

c6328e38-1877-4e88-900b-6aa6f3e3ff98.description: The individual who has earned this badge will know what an ePortfolio is and why we use it at SLCC, what the ePortfolio requirements are for students and faculty, how to use and create excellent reflection prompts, and revise or create new signature assignments for their courses.
c6328e38-1877-4e88-900b-6aa6f3e3ff98.name: ePortfolio Pedagogy Credential

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Participants must complete the ePortfolio Boot Camp training and design or revise a signature assignment and reflection prompt or activity for one of the courses they are teaching.

e9417541-813e-4a22-ae28-a2ef2e588df3.description: This self-paced online course introduces instructors to key concepts and principles for equitable and inclusive teaching. Participants explore strategies for reducing inequities in higher education that create barriers to learning for community college students. The course includes definitions, short readings, videos, reflective questions, teaching strategies, and other resources.
e9417541-813e-4a22-ae28-a2ef2e588df3.name: Foundations of Inclusive Teaching Course

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Participants completed a series of self-paced learning activities, recorded their teaching ideas in a notebook or teaching journal, and completed a formal reflection.

54555d00-eee4-418f-8fbc-dbfe82a84195.description: Earners of the Livestream Teacher Credential (LTC) have demonstrated skill in teaching live-streamed courses. To earn the credential, participants must satisfactorily complete the Livestream Teacher Credential course. For the capstone course assignment, participants use synchronous technology tools to deliver an interactive lesson that demonstrates teaching strategies that promote active learning in a remote learning environment.
54555d00-eee4-418f-8fbc-dbfe82a84195.name: Livestream Teacher Credential

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete this online course, which is facilitated by livestream teaching experts at Salt Lake Community College. Satisfactorily complete all assignments in the course, including the final project.

skills.name: Demonstrate teaching strategies that promote active learning in a remote learning environment
Discuss privacy and equity concerns related to teaching in a remote learning environment
Facilitate active learning in a remote learning environment
Model best practices for web conferencing
Orient students to a remote learning environment
Set expectations for students in a remote learning environment
Teach an interactive lesson in a remote learning environment using synchronous technology tools

3fa2ddb1-5a1a-4f24-956f-a150b4718e20.description: Earners have completed the Community-Engaged Learning Professional Development Course. Earners have gained knowledge about high-impact practices as well as community-engaged learning theory and research. Earners have learned about the SLCC college-wide civic literacy student learning outcome and documented ways to incorporate it or revise it in courses. Participants have identified community partners and created assignments that build civic literacy and have developed methods of assessment.
3fa2ddb1-5a1a-4f24-956f-a150b4718e20.name: Community-Engaged Learning Professional Development Credential

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: The earner completed all modules in the Service-Learning Professional Development Series. The course consists of online modules The modules contain readings, discussions and assignments focused on high-impact practices, service-learning theory and research, effective community partnerships, civic literacy, assessment, and critical reflection.  The participant must complete at least 80% of the course to receive credit.

The earner completed all modules in the Community-Engaged Learning Professional Development Course. The course consists of online modules. The modules contain readings, discussions and assignments focused on high-impact practices, theory and research, effective community partnerships, civic literacy, assessment, and critical reflection. The participant must complete at least 80% of the course to receive credit.

47aa824e-f721-492c-92fc-8ed0da2787a8.description: The purpose of the EITP Level 3 Leadership program is to help instructors a) continue their learning as equity-minded community college educators through individualized professional development, b) work toward leading or collaborating in efforts to improve student learning in their programs, and c) apply principles for educational equity to their fields of study.
47aa824e-f721-492c-92fc-8ed0da2787a8.name: Equitable & Inclusive Teaching: Level 3 Leadership

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Participating instructors work on designing and then implementing a substantial individual or collaborative project focused on equitable and inclusive teaching practices. After completing the project, participants share their work with colleagues in their fields of study. They also contribute to an equitable and inclusive teaching practices online resource for the SLCC community and document their work through a professional ePortfolio page.

1c0c3fb3-6047-41c4-b4d6-60264d05320c.description: This credential represents the successful completion of a self-paced Writing Across the College Canvas course that provides participants with an introduction to linguistic bias and how Standardized American English impacts students at SLCC. Upon completion, participants will understand the complexity of the debate regarding language varieties in education and know how to affirm students' English language varieties that they bring to college.
1c0c3fb3-6047-41c4-b4d6-60264d05320c.name: Teaching Towards Linguistic Justice

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this credential, a participant will successfully complete the TTLJ self-paced Canvas course: ten modules that include video presentations and reflective responses. Additionally, participants engage in a half-hour informal conversation with the WAC director or a learning community discussion. The participant will identify at least three strategies they will implement in their courses to support writing success for all students.

2f0777c9-b7f6-4cf2-bd28-dfb841b3e5fa.description: This credential represents the successful completion of a self-paced Writing Across the College Canvas course that introduces how students with invisible disabilities and/or neurodiverse brain processing may experience writing in higher education. Upon completion, participants will have a basic understanding of cognitive processes involved in writing, intersections of invisible disabilities and higher education, and how to provide equitable opportunities for writing success to all students.
2f0777c9-b7f6-4cf2-bd28-dfb841b3e5fa.name: Writing with Hidden Disabilities

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this credential, a participant will successfully complete the WHD self-paced Canvas course: ten modules that include video presentations and reflective responses. Additionally, participants engage in a half-hour informal conversation with the WAC director or a learning community discussion. The participant will identify at least three strategies they will implement in their courses to support writing success for all students.

8c11deb3-6b64-4af8-85ee-45207e8c5ded.description: The person who has earned this badge has the following skills in Digication: they can view and navigate student ePortfolios, use templates, know the options for privacy settings and have enough basic skills to create their own ePortfolio using Digication.
8c11deb3-6b64-4af8-85ee-45207e8c5ded.name: ePortfolio Technology Credential

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Participant must complete the Digication 101 workshop and create a sample ePortfolio page for one of the classes they are teaching using the Digication platform.

4971ca89-aabd-4f14-b900-79db825f1a41.description: Participants will be able to recognize, correct and create accessible documents, videos, images and webpages.
4971ca89-aabd-4f14-b900-79db825f1a41.name: Universal Access Credential

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Attend the Universal Access Combined Core Training Workshop or complete the online Universal Access Combined Core Training Workshop
Complete A Personalized Accessibility Project

e7431f90-2fa2-4caa-aebc-0e5b2377eb48.description: Earners of the Information Literacy badge will be able to connect the principals and threshold concepts of information literacy to their disciplines, and therefore, to their programs, courses, and assignments. These candidates will put these connections into practice by redesigning an assignment, course module, or lecture to incorporate these concepts; or by reconfiguring a course or program to more accurately reflect the standards of information literacy which are germane to their discipline.
e7431f90-2fa2-4caa-aebc-0e5b2377eb48.name: Information Literacy Credential

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Participant will have attended all sessions, completed all tasks associated with sessions.

The final project is ideally a signature assignment for inclusion in students’ ePortfolio, incorporating the Info Lit Threshold Concepts.  This assignment should be scaffolded into a current course curriculum and should not be without context to the rest of the course.

4cf37db9-5b31-4313-b4e7-63c9c2c1ba0a.description: For students to succeed in college, they must read effectively across different fields of study . This requires that students become aware of and adapt to shifting reading expectations. Participants in this course will learn strategies to support students in their transition to reading across the college by identifying reading expectations in their own areas and implementing teaching strategies, assignments, and activities in their courses.
4cf37db9-5b31-4313-b4e7-63c9c2c1ba0a.name: Successful Student Readers

issuer.summary: issued by Salt Lake Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Six hour course includes meeting with course facilitator.
